function-help-entry.name: fnDPPConcFromMean
function-help-entry.title: The expected value of the concentration parameter from the mean number of parameter categories for the DPP distribution.

description.p: This function calculates the approximate expected value for the Dirichlet process prior distribution concentration parameter given a mean number of parameter categories for a specified number of elements.

argument.label: num_cats
argument.description: The mean number of rate categories.

argument.label: num_elements
argument.description: The number of elements in the DPP distribution.

details.p: This function computes an approximation of the expected value of the concentration parameter (a) for a given number of elements (N) and a given number of parameter categories (k) based on the formula given in Liu (1996). (See also McAuliffe et al. 2006, Jara et al. 2007, and Heath et al. 2012.)

function-help-entry.example:
## number of DPP elements N <- 10
## prior mean number of categories k <- 8
## concentration parameter of the DPP a <- fnDPPConcFromMean(k, N)
## G_0 distribution g_0 = dnExponential(1.0)
## DPP distribution constructior rates ~ dnDPP(a, g_0, N)

reference.citation: Liu JS. 1996. Nonparametric hierarchical Bayes via sequential imputa- tions. Ann Stat. 3:911–930.
McAuliffe JD, Blei DM, Jordan MI. 2006. Nonparametric empirical Bayes for the Dirichlet process mixture model. Stat Comput. 16: 5–14.
Jara A, Garcia-Zattera MJ, Lesaffre E. 2007. A Dirichlet process mixture model for the analysis of correlated binary responses. Comput Stat Data Anal. 51:5402–5415.
Heath TA, Holder MT, Huelsenbeck JP. 2012. A Dirichlet process prior for estimating lineage-specific substitution rates. Mol. Biol. Evol. 29(3):939–955.
